item.title: Audience
item.description: Audience who is this guide for? what should they already know? familiar with CI/CD, devops concepts some exposure to a CI/CD platform Job Titles: DevOps Engineers Platform Engineers

item.title: Goals
item.description: Goals This guide aims to explain how teams in the {{market_segment}} can accelerate their development workflows while maintaining strict application and operational security using the principles of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) and DevSecOps. We provide a solution to walk you through how you can quickly set up your own DevSecOps pipeline that incorporates Amazon Web Services (AWS) and third-party security tools to give you a fast, flexible, and secure software delivery process.

item.title: Prerequisites
item.description: Prerequisites concepts (CI/CD&D, ops, devops, secops, devsecops) tech stack (AWS, CCI, terminal, code editor)

item.title: Cci Onboarding
item.description: CCI onboarding Clone sample repo, no config Adding project with starter config CircleCI app vocabulary and UI/views jobs workflows pipelines

item.title: ECR
item.description: To create an ECR repo for your images, navigate to the ECR dashboard in the AWS console. In the ECR dashboard, click Create repository. On the Create repository page, enter a name for the repository. After naming the repository, scroll down to the section titled Image scan settings and click the toggle to enable Scan on push. TIP: Configuring registry-level scan settings. At the bottom of the page, click on the button to Create repository.

item.title: Building a Pipeline
item.description: Updating config config editor VS Code extension Defining jobs [sast, test] executors convenience images (language stack) steps parallelism test splitting Creating workflows requires Getting help config reference support articles discuss blogs

item.title: OpenID Connect
item.description: TIP: What is OIDC? Why use it? Add a context to the job what is a context? Set up OIDC In AWS, navigate to the IAM console. In the navigation pane on the left side of the screen, click Identity providers. In the next window, click Add provider. To configure the provider, start by selecting the option for OpenID Connect. The provider URL is in this format: https://oidc.circleci.com/org/ORGANIZATION_ID, where ORGANIZATION_ID refers to the organization you used to sign in to CircleCI.

item.title: IAM Roles and Permissions
item.description: Creating an IAM Role From the IAM dashboard, navigate to the Create role page by clicking Roles in the navigation pane then clicking the Create role button. In the section titled Trusted entity type, select Web identity; and in the section titled Web identity, use the dropdown menu to select the IdP you created in the preceding section. After selecting an IdP, use the Audience dropdown menu to select the audience you added in the preceding section.
